title: Grade 9 - Building the Entrepreneurial Mindset BEM1O (2024)
subject: Business Studies

document.title: Grade 9 - Building the Entrepreneurial Mindset BEM1O (2024)

1591F0DA71A847339C7FBB853A669216.description: present final business texts using appropriate digital and oral presentation tools and techniques to inform and persuade an intended audience

690B44B956B3498A8D641C3BE02B62A5.description: publish final business texts using appropriate digital tools and techniques to inform and persuade an intended audience

A68565231400454F97F3931FA01C6700.description: Publishing and Presenting: publish and present final business texts in an accessible format, including digital and media texts, using appropriate digital and oral presentation tools and techniques

2C77EA6501B64666B4C0D34138796CC1.description: revise draft business texts, including editing and proofreading them, to improve clarity, accuracy, accessibility, and effectiveness, using various strategies and seeking and selectively using feedback

2943F8DE8F5F43BAB4DEE2BAFA802C7E.description: research and select appropriate and accessible fonts, colours, and visual elements to enhance the graphic design and format of their business texts, using digital tools and techniques

5E6E6D74B0C84832BD19D72BBF211122.description: draft business texts for a variety of purposes and audiences using clear language as well as appropriate business terminology, text forms, and digital tools and techniques

0E670F30E66540CC9F0DA99594DB6591.description: Creating Business Texts: create a variety of draft business texts, including digital and media texts, using clear language as well as appropriate business terminology, text forms, design elements, and digital tools and techniques

B992FE9867F2435C84517F145CEA078C.description: research, synthesize, and organize information from a variety of sources to support the topic and purpose of various business texts and to provide accurate and credible communication

A938B1D7BA714669950A7B06CED1DC83.description: identify the topic, purpose, and audience for various business texts they plan to create, and choose a business text form to suit the purpose and audience

FC8FC4E46C264F789B44C721239F8A94.description: Developing and Organizing Idea: generate and develop ideas for a variety of business texts, including digital and media texts, and research, synthesize, and organize the ideas and information

34D5F704989348D18DF005AA9D933C6A.description: present their final pitch, gather feedback from the audience, and identify next steps

6C1CDB05888A426CA446D191FDB944FC.description: demonstrate an understanding of the elements of a pitch presentation by developing one for their business venture

0327536FD8114DB99D9B9335761EB51B.description: identify and compare various supports, including funding opportunities, available for entrepreneurs, recognizing the importance of access to resources and mentorship, and explain how a pitch presentation could help secure potential support

DC6144DEEF154A8FB4EC07ED97CF2438.description: Pitching an Entrepreneurial Idea: use a pitch process to effectively communicate their entrepreneurial idea to various audiences for the purpose of gathering support for a potential entrepreneurial venture

F6CB19AFC3474B00B0AE4F8D368390F1.description: use a problem solving process to define and address identified challenges and opportunities, applying appropriate strategies to refine their idea and prototype to maximize the potential for economic success and positive social, environmental, and ethical outcomes

C3D99ED872B54038A300E0143C7270C2.description: produce a simple budget to assess the financial outlook for their potential entrepreneurial venture

AF319B32274B4668A324C4BEFCB55FE9.description: analyze the social, economic, environmental, and ethical impacts their entrepreneurial venture idea might have by identifying various stakeholder perspectives on their product or service

F3E50064477E4EB4BE297F6CAFA367AD.description: Refining an Entrepreneurial Idea: use a problem solving process to assess and refine their entrepreneurial idea, considering its social, economic, environmental, and ethical impacts

E5AE5379D8D24B9EB6F4F40563807826.description: create a prototype, which could include a storyboard, to illustrate their product or service’s intended purpose and benefits, and test the prototype's ability to address the market need or opportunity

E5004239E4DF42139752E7B16DE15130.description: select and describe an idea that reflects their interests and that they could pursue as an entrepreneurial venture to address a market need or opportunity

953A9F6B71B949D6AD99EEFE92559459.description: develop criteria, based on individual goals and interests, research, and an understanding of entrepreneurship, to evaluate ideas they could pursue as a possible entrepreneurial venture

C90AD06F06AB4F48B6E61968B9F7052A.description: generate new ideas and/or build on the ideas of others for a new product or service that meets a market need or opportunity, informed by different perspectives

943AD8A4EAD049A78EF2BEAE78EAF810.description: Designing an Entrepreneurial Idea: use a design process to identify how to meet various market needs and opportunities, and select and develop an entrepreneurial idea to pursue

BD55A209F46C42D8AC30710F0C625186.description: describe the different business ownership structures that entrepreneurs can use to launch and scale their businesses

51AD9BB3472D423A9ABDD11BC42A66D8.description: assess their own entrepreneurial potential, including their skills and experience, and develop a plan to grow as an entrepreneur

024DB074C95440BC9052B427E4D32860.description: describe how the experiences of entrepreneurs in Canada, including First Nations, Métis, or Inuit entrepreneurs, led them to innovate and create new products or services

B21B2C3C7C8A4751BAEA6EA55DC7AC95.description: identify and describe what constitutes an entrepreneurial mindset

8F67D6E5C9D646FA862D114C4A6BFB87.description: The Entrepreneurial Mindset: demonstrate an understanding of the mindset necessary to succeed as an entrepreneur, and describe how the experiences of various entrepreneurs led them to innovate and start new businesses

348F445146494F92B7230AAF3F53DECC.description: analyze challenges faced by entrepreneurs from various communities, and identify supports available to help address these challenges

AF0CCFB0BF0F49A5B1BF0E17FEE756C9.description: describe the contributions and impacts of successful entrepreneurs from diverse local, Canadian, and global communities

D0912B423DB0430A85F13A31A384F6D6.description: describe ways in which different entrepreneurial ventures have addressed social, economic, environmental, and ethical issues

0A127C907055433F9526AC18DDA16956.description: Contributions of Entrepreneurs: describe how entrepreneurs contribute to social, economic, and environmental progress, and analyze challenges that they face, identifying ways to address these challenges

5F8BEA940E56454F937371DAEEC0011F.description: create and maintain a portfolio that illustrates their business competencies and growth as an entrepreneur

ECC69F7007E0441099C9814E7C823E63.description: describe how their learning in this course can be applied in a variety of careers, including self-employment, entrepreneurship, or skilled trades

CBB8056CEE204051A7CF27F344C22E6D.description: analyze and explain how business skills and knowledge, including financial literacy, can support learning in other subject areas, in-school job skills programs, and community-based programs

65F2345106FB4A1A989BC611A4831142.description: describe ways in which problem solving and creative and critical thinking can be applied to address local and global real-world opportunities and challenges

E097CBA89BF3467B886797A0FD0DA06A.description: Connections, Applications, and Careers: analyze how business skills and knowledge can be applied in other subject areas and in a variety of careers

DCA15576A5B14638BCDE61B7839BF23D.description: select and use the most appropriate digital technologies, tools, and applications to complete a variety of business-related tasks and projects

FFF25024C15C43F3A804489ACC75E297.description: analyze and compare the benefits, limitations, costs, and risks, including risks to online safety and data security, associated with various digital technologies, tools, and applications used to complete business-related tasks and projects

43A597BA7CC74B9D9B9576A38939B968.description: identify a variety of existing and emerging digital technologies, tools, and applications designed to support the completion of various business-related tasks and projects

B5E8A796705C412C80149495EC494478.description: Business Technologies: demonstrate an understanding of business-related digital technologies and use them in a way that respects their own and others’ online safety and data security to complete a variety of business-related tasks and projects

CE4A5937A0484ECF965DD63DFA8FA93D.description: evaluate tasks and projects on a regular basis in terms of goals, key performance indicators, and outcomes, taking into account feedback gathered from a variety of sources

52903485FBE54E74A15098C6B0F65829.description: use a project management process to manage the main aspects of a business project, including goals, key performance indicators, resources, delegation of tasks and responsibilities, progress of tasks, deadlines, and risks, while demonstrating a leadership style appropriate to each situation

FE13B511EE2B4AAA90BA6A51B7C220FA.description: compare various business leadership styles and explain why it might be appropriate to use a particular style in a particular situation

0E80B6369B3F4192ACDA471214AE1653.description:
Business Leadership and Project Management:
demonstrate an understanding of various business leadership styles and use a project management process when performing business-related tasks

8831755DCE53465BBA1BA05B5814D745.description: Business Leadership, Project Management, and Connections
